meanings.definition: In a monochromatic manner; using only one color.
meanings.sent1: She painted the room monochromatically, using only shades of blue.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to decorate the wall monochromatically with various tones of gray.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer dressed the models monochromatically in all red outfits.
meanings.sent4: The sky was painted monochromatically with hues of orange during the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered monochromatically in the wind, displaying a single color.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or displaying only one color.
meanings.sent1: The monochromatic painting on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit was monochromatic, consisting of various shades of green.
meanings.sent3: The monochromatic cake looked delicious with its single color frosting.
meanings.sent4: The monochromatic landscape seemed to blend seamlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in a monochromatic style, creating a calming atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Using or involving only one color.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a stunning piece using a monochromatic color scheme.
meanings.sent2: The monochromatic photograph captured the essence of simplicity.
meanings.sent3: The monochromatic outfit made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The room was painted in a monochromatic tone, giving it a modern look.
meanings.sent5: The painting was done monochromatically, highlighting the beauty of simplicity.
